alert.note: Alert for Boone; Bracken; Campbell; Gallatin; Grant; Kenton; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN KENTON, WEST CENTRAL BRACKEN, SOUTHERN CAMPBELL, SOUTHERN BOONE, NORTHEASTERN GRANT, CENTRAL PENDLETON AND EASTERN GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Walton to near Butler, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Walton, Falmouth, Crittenden, Butler, Munk, Atwood, Greenwood, Richwood, Ryle, Morning View, Northcutt, Bracht, Gardnersville, Lenoxburg, Kincaid Lake State Park, Knoxville, US Routes 42 and 127 at State Route 562, Fiskburg, Catawba and Gene Snyder Airport. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 68 and 77. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 162 and 175. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
